spocs.title: Productivity Hack for Top Performing Professionals
spocs.excerpt: Entrepreneurs and VCs count on this intelligent contact app to effortlessly manage relationships.

spocs.title: 7 Benefits of Using CRM Software
spocs.excerpt: Learn how customer relationship management tools can help fuel business growth.

spocs.title: How Well Do You Know Your Customers?
spocs.excerpt: Learn how you can use your audience data to unlock smarter marketing.

spocs.title: Why Should I Use DuckDuckGo Instead of Google?
spocs.excerpt: Here's the definitive answer for why you should use DuckDuckGo to protect your privacy online.

spocs.title: The Search Engine that Doesn't Track Your Data
spocs.excerpt: Unlike Google and Facebook, DuckDuckGo is profitable without collecting your personal data. Here's how.

spocs.title: What Is DuckDuckGo's Business Model?
spocs.excerpt: Unlike Google and Facebook, DuckDuckGo is profitable without collecting your personal data. Here's how.

spocs.title: Everything Google Knows About You
spocs.excerpt: Learn about the depths of the company's tracking & how to reduce your Google footprint.

recommendations.title: Custodians of a Ghostly Campus Legacy
recommendations.excerpt: A pair of talented stonemasons with a murderous feud gave Toronto’s oldest university its hauntingly intricate architecture—and its first ghost story.

recommendations.title: The children of Donor H898
recommendations.excerpt: BARTLETT, Ill. — Danielle Rizzo’s son is screaming. He is planted in the middle of the lobby of his elementary school, clinging to rainbow-colored blocks as she gently explains that she is here — off schedule, in the middle of the day — to take him to a doctor’s appointment.

recommendations.title: Young People Are Going to Save Us All From Office Life
recommendations.excerpt: When Ariel Coleman, 28, quit her last job, as a project manager in the corporate office of a bank, it wasn’t because her new employer offered her a raise, a different role or more seniority. “The work-life balance is just much better,” she said.

recommendations.title: How to Survive a Lightning Strike
recommendations.excerpt: Every year, more than 500 Americans will be struck by lightning—and roughly 90 percent of them will survive. Though they remain among the living, their minds and bodies will be instantly, fundamentally altered in ways that still leave scientists scratching their heads.

recommendations.title: The hidden tactic overloaded workers are using to catch up
recommendations.excerpt: Workplaces are increasingly lean – and everyone wants to make a good impression. But if you’re taking leave to catch up on work, it may be time to speak up.

recommendations.title: Parenting’s New Frontier: What Happens When Your 11-Year-Old Says No to a Smartphone?
recommendations.excerpt: TOWARD THE BACK of my top dresser drawer—the one for pajamas—I have an iPhone 4 in a lime-green case. I bought this now-obsolete phone, refurbished, years ago, as a gift for my son on his 11th birthday.

recommendations.title: How Bitcoin Ends
recommendations.excerpt: Is the cryptocurrency just going to end up reenforcing the financial system it was supposed to disrupt? Bitcoin was a clever idea. Idealistic, even. But it isn’t working out quite as its developers imagined.

recommendations.title: The truth about RVs
recommendations.excerpt: Industry veterans say complaints about quality will persist, despite the best efforts made by the RV industry.

recommendations.title: My Mom Paid For Our Middle Class Life By Running An Illegal Lottery Business
recommendations.excerpt: "I knew my mother was in the Numbers, but I also knew not to tell that to anyone."

recommendations.title: Should You Quit Your Job? When To Leave And When To Stick It Out
recommendations.excerpt: Sometimes it’s really time to move on, but other times, you’ll be better off sticking it out. Here’s how to know which situation you are in.

recommendations.title: The Hunt for the Serial Killer of Laredo
recommendations.excerpt: Last September, law enforcement officers were confounded by a murderer targeting prostitutes along the border. As the investigation intensified, they discovered that the killer had been hiding in plain sight.

recommendations.title: Want to be less distracted? Try this: Find the fun in tedious tasks
recommendations.excerpt: Most of us blame our phones as the reason we can’t get anything done. But the real culprit often isn’t those shiny devices, which means we can stay focused simply by switching our perspective, says technology expert Nir Eyal.

recommendations.title: The Man Who Got America High
recommendations.excerpt: He chartered the Rolling Stones while smuggling Pablo Escobar’s drugs on the side. After disappearing for decades, Alfred Dellentash finally shares his unbelievable life story.

recommendations.title: Jack Conte, Patreon, and the Plight of the Creative Class
recommendations.excerpt: The DIY musician's membership platform set out to provide a livelihood for artists on the internet. Is it more than just a band-aid for a broken system?

recommendations.title: A second chance
recommendations.excerpt: Twelve years ago, 47 dogs were rescued from Michael Vick’s dogfighting operation and allowed to live. They've enriched the lives of countless humans and altered the course of animal welfare.

recommendations.title: How to Be More Productive Without Putting in Extra Hours
recommendations.excerpt: Small changes. Big results.

recommendations.title: Brad Pitt Is Still Searching
recommendations.excerpt: Brad Pitt doesn't give interviews often, and when he does, they tend to happen in strange and impromptu places. Like this poolhouse, on a property that belongs to neither of us, not too far outside Pasadena.

recommendations.title: A Brutal Murder, a Wearable Witness, and an Unlikely Suspect
recommendations.excerpt: Karen Navarra was a quiet woman in her sixties who lived alone. She was found beaten to death. The neighbors didn't see anything. But her Fitbit did.

recommendations.title: Victorian Culinary Trading Cards Are a Feast for the Eyes
recommendations.excerpt: But maybe not for your stomach.

recommendations.title: Why Donna Tartt's The Secret History Never Became a Movie
recommendations.excerpt: It isn't every book that becomes an instant literary sensation. Since its release, The Secret History has always been something special.
